com.magnet.spi

Interface ServiceProvider

  • All Superinterfaces:
    PlatformProvider
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    LogicalConnector<T>, ServiceConnector<T>, ServiceDecorator<T>, ServiceInterceptor<T>, ServiceListener<T>, ServiceValidator<T>

    public interface ServiceProvider
extends PlatformProvider
    Super contract for all Service Providers / Connectors.

    Service Providers are categorized into one or more of the following:

  • Interceptors - Are either typed (e.g., User Interceptor) or cross-cutting (e.g., Transaction Interceptor). Interceptors provide the ability to wrap, redirect, or short-circuit normal processing. This allows for interleaving of operations in the normal flow of operations. These are representative as "ArroundIvoke" point cuts in AoP.
  • Decorators - Are always typed (e.g., User Decorators). Decorators provide the ability to modify the context / data of a method invocation. It does not, however, have the ability to wrap, redirect, or short-circuit normal processing. This is useful when appending default values to an object or request for instance.
  • Validators - Are always typed (e.g., User Validators). Validators provide the ability to short-circuit / fail the processing flow when the context / data of a method invocation is improper based on some predefined policy (application logic or security related).
  • Connectors - Are always typed (e.g., User Connectors). Connectors provide access to the some external system. They therefore are dealing with I/O and are expected to fail from time-to-time because of IOExceptions. Connectors represent the "core" functionality behind the conceptual operation being performed.
  • Listeners - Are always typed (e.g., User Listeners). Listeners provide a callback mechanism, to be notified in the event of failed or successful operations.

    The flow of control within , in the simplest sense, can be diagrammed as follows: 

                       _________________________________________________________
                  /                                                         \
  -> [Interceptor]->{{{[Decorator]}->[Validator]->Connector}->{[Listener]}}->[Interceptor]->
    Legend:
  • [] - represents optional constructs. Note how a Connector is the only required Provider type. The absence of a Connector is an error condition.
  • {} - represents a try-catch block trapping exceptions.

    Note that PlatformProviders can implement multiple ServiceProvider interfaces thereby allowing for reuse across various locations of the infrastructure.

    For example, and implementation can be both a UsersDecorator as well as a UsersListener.

    Any service provider that is incapable of making a call due to insufficient configuration and/or design implementation should throw an UnsupportedOperationException. The underlying Engine is capable of handling these exceptions.

See Also:
ServiceInterceptor, ServiceConnector, ServiceValidator, ServiceListener

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Set<Class<?>> getSupportedTargets()
      A service provider can answer which interfaces it supports (aka targets), and wishes to become a provider for those targets.

      • Methods inherited from interface com.magnet.spi.PlatformProvider

        getVersion

    • Method Detail

      • getSupportedTargets

        Set<Class<?>> getSupportedTargets()
        A service provider can answer which interfaces it supports (aka targets), and wishes to become a provider for those targets.

        This method can be used to dynamically (based on configuration for example) answers to which Api's are supported by this provider.

        The alternative form of declaration is via SupportedTargets.
